target_title: White space loop when opening email

note.body:
Does this happen on older versions?

(You can try `flatpak install geary`, and then `sudo flatpak update org.gnome.Geary --commit=be721a86d627c00d1f9d9b972ffbd1b1a5cd3481f8a32212721caeab7ec921e3`)

I'm investigating my bug here ( #1646 ), and can reproduce this. It's probably related to a way in which height setting is currently implemented.

- 1. Geary creates a WebKit instance
  - 2. WebKit sends `window.document.documentElement.scrollHeight` back to GTK/Geary
- 3. Geary is setting `preferred_height`.
  - 4. WebKit recalculates element size and `updatePreferredHeight` is triggered again
  - 5. Go to step 2.

target_title: "Gtk:cannot open display" error trying to run Geary Flatpak

note.body:
> The same behaviour for Evolution and Firefox. This started last month.

So it really looks like your issue is unrelated to Geary at this point really. Have you tried asking a question on the Ubuntu forums instead? I think this should be the next place your quest continues, unless you can pinpoint this to be a Geary-specific issues. At this point, I'm mostly thinking of closing this issue.

> How can I view and paste the full logs in this case?

Try launching the terminal and running geary/firefox/evolution from there.

Note that your screenshots are showing that you're running an Xorg session, so Wayland is definitely not related either.

target_title: Outdated information in BUILDING.md

note.body:
Additionally, `meson.build` sets `target_webkit = '2.30'` while the actual requirement is at least '2.40': e.g., the `src/client/conversation-viewer/conversation-message.vala` file uses `evaluate_javascript` function from `webkit2gtk` package, which is only available [since 2.40](https://valadoc.org/webkit2gtk-4.1/WebKit.WebView.evaluate_javascript.html).

I didn't check, but I suspect that `target_vala = '0.48.18'` in `meson.build` is also not true.

----

For the benefit of others like me who want to build geary on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (or on Pop OS 22.04) let me note that if you run into compile errors related to the non-availability of the `evaluate_javascript` symbol, make sure of two things:
1. Your `libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0` package has version at least 2.40;
2. The vala binding for webkit2gtk-4.1 on your system (e.g., for me this is the `/usr/share/vala-0.56/vapi/webkit2gtk-4.1.vapi` file provided by the `valac-0.56-vapi` package) is updated to describe the `evaluate_javascript` function of the C library.

On my system the most up-to-date version of `valac-0.56-vapi` is 0.56.0-1, which is too old. I replaced the vapi file with [the one from the vala repository](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/vala/-/blob/master/vapi/webkit2gtk-4.1.vapi) and now geary compiles.

(Due to my lack of familiarity with vala and related tooling it took me at least four hours to diagnose and fix this compile error. And all I wanted was just to change the hardcoded widths of columns (GNOME/geary#1638, GNOME/geary#1611, GNOME/geary#1029)...

target_title: IMAP server "connection refused" in AWS

note.body:
> Geary version: 40.0

Hi @diggles, thanks for reporting this. Unfortunately you are using a version that is 41 months old and not supported anymore by GNOME developers. There will not be any bug fixes or feature additions by GNOME developers for the version that you use.

Please feel free to reopen this issue if this situation still happens with a more recent version of GNOME. Feel also free to report this in the issue tracking system of your Linux distribution if your Linux distribution still supports your current version.

You could also bring this up in a support forum instead.

target_title: IMAP server "connection refused" in AWS
